title: Civil Rights Leaders Quiz
description: How well do you remember the brave leaders of the civil rights movement?

questions.question: Who delivered the famous 'I Have a Dream' speech in 1963?
questions.explanation: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his iconic 'I Have a Dream' speech during the March on Washington on August 28, 1963.

questions.question: Who refused to give up her bus seat in Montgomery, Alabama in 1955?
questions.explanation: Rosa Parks refused to give up her seat to a white passenger on December 1, 1955, sparking the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

questions.question: Which civil rights leader founded the Nation of Islam's influence and later embraced Sunni Islam?
questions.explanation: Malcolm X was a prominent minister in the Nation of Islam before his pilgrimage to Mecca led him to embrace orthodox Sunni Islam.

questions.question: Who was the first African American to serve on the U.S. Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: Thurgood Marshall was appointed to the Supreme Court in 1967 by President Lyndon B. Johnson, serving until 1991.

questions.question: Who co-founded the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC) and later became a U.S. Congressman?
questions.explanation: John Lewis was a founding member and chairman of SNCC and later served as a U.S. Representative from Georgia for over 30 years.

questions.question: Which leader organized the 1963 March on Washington?
questions.explanation: Bayard Rustin was the chief organizer of the 1963 March on Washington, though A. Philip Randolph was the official director of the march.

questions.question: Who was the NAACP field secretary murdered in Mississippi in 1963?
questions.explanation: Medgar Evers, the NAACP's first field secretary in Mississippi, was assassinated in his driveway on June 12, 1963.

questions.question: Which woman testified about voter registration abuse, saying 'I'm sick and tired of being sick and tired'?
questions.explanation: Fannie Lou Hamer was a voting rights activist from Mississippi who became famous for her powerful testimony and determination.

questions.question: Who led the Southern Christian Leadership Conference alongside Dr. King?
questions.explanation: Ralph Abernathy was Martin Luther King Jr.'s closest friend and fellow leader of the SCLC, succeeding King as president after his assassination.

questions.question: Which activist helped desegregate interstate bus travel through the Freedom Rides?
questions.explanation: James Farmer, co-founder of the Congress of Racial Equality (CORE), organized the 1961 Freedom Rides to challenge segregation in interstate transportation.

questions.question: Who was the first Black woman elected to the U.S. Congress?
questions.explanation: Shirley Chisholm was elected to Congress in 1968 representing New York, and in 1972 she became the first Black candidate to seek a major party's presidential nomination.

questions.question: Which leader coined the phrase 'Black Power' during the Meredith March?
questions.explanation: Stokely Carmichael (later Kwame Ture) popularized the phrase 'Black Power' during the 1966 March Against Fear in Mississippi.

questions.question: Who was the longtime head of the NAACP from 1929 to 1955?
questions.explanation: Walter White served as executive secretary of the NAACP from 1929 to 1955, leading the organization during crucial years of the civil rights struggle.

questions.question: Which civil rights leader helped found the National Council of Negro Women?
questions.explanation: Mary McLeod Bethune founded the National Council of Negro Women in 1935 and was a close advisor to President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

questions.question: Who was the nine-year-old girl famously escorted by federal marshals to an all-white school in New Orleans in 1960?
questions.explanation: Ruby Bridges was six years old (not nine) when she became the first African American child to desegregate William Frantz Elementary School in New Orleans in 1960.
